# Nvidia Stock Investors Got Great News From Palantir and Teradyne

ByBeth McKenna – Feb 3, 2026 at 9:09PM EST

## NASDAQ: NVDA

### Nvidia

Market Cap

Today's Change

(-2.82%) $5.23

Current Price

$180.38 [...] Today's Change

(-2.82%) $5.23

Current Price

$180.38

Price as ofFebruary 3, 2026 at 3:58 PMET

## Key Points

 Nvidia is, by far, the dominant maker of artificial intelligence (AI) chips and related technology.
 So, when large companies in the AI space report strong demand for their AI-related products, this is a positive for Nvidia.
 Palantir Technologies and Teradyne just reported fourth-quarter results that sprinted by Wall Street's estimates.
 We’re bullish on these 10 stocks › [...] Avg Vol

3.2M

Gross Margin

57.96%

Dividend Yield

0.17%

In Q4, Teradyne's revenue jumped 44% year over year to $1.08 billion, driven by strong demand for its testing equipment for AI-related chips, both compute (the category that includes the GPUs that Nvidia designs) and memory (Nvidia buys memory chips for integration with its GPUs for its AI data center chips). Adjusted EPS soared 89% year over year to $1.80, crushing the $1.38 Wall Street had expected.

CEO Greg Smith said, "In 2026, we expect year-over-year growth across all of our businesses, with strong momentum in compute driven by AI."

Teradyne stock rocketed 13.4% on Tuesday.

## Nvidia reports its quarterly earnings on Feb. 25

results.title: Nvidia Stock Dips On OpenAI Funding Issues - Investor's Business Daily
results.content:
BREAKING: Palantir Jumps Late, Leads Big Earnings Movers

 Technology

# Nvidia Stock Dips On OpenAI Funding Issues

Nvidia (NVDA) stock dipped Monday on conflicting news reports that the artificial intelligence chipmaker lacked confidence in major customer OpenAI and might have doubts about how much to fund it.

The Wall Street Journal reported Friday that Nvidia's plan to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI to help it train and run AI models had stalled. Nvidia insiders expressed doubts about the deal, announced last September, the article said.

The report said Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang had privately criticized what he has described as a lack of discipline in OpenAI's business approach. He also expressed concerns about the competition OpenAI faces from Anthropic and Alphabet's (GOOGL) Google.

On Saturday, Huang told reporters that Nvidia was prepared to invest "a great deal of money" in OpenAI, Reuters reported. "I believe in OpenAI. The work that they do is incredible. They're one of the most consequential companies of our time."

Huang didn't say exactly how much the company would invest in OpenAI but described it as "huge" and potentially "the largest investment we've ever made."
